name: Chasm Spelunkers
desc: Now that you have destroyed the Bedrock Keys, the seal on The Chasm has now come undone. It is time to venture into the depths below.

customize.name: Surreptitious Seven-Star Seal Sundering
customize.desc: You have accepted a commission that requires you to pay The Chasm a visit. Who knows what the situation in the long-sealed mines might be like...

customize.name: The Chasm Delvers
customize.desc: A World Quest Series following Zhiqiong, an aspiring adventurer, to investigate The Chasm: Underground Mines.

customize.name: The Chasm Charters
customize.desc:
Accept the commission from Lan
Lan of the Adventurers' Guild has offered you a commission to explore The Chasm, which you have accepted. First, you'll need to find the representative of the Ministry of Civil Affairs, Muning, who has been stationed there.

Accept the commission from Xu
You accept Xu's commission to deliver the Mora Xingqiu has lent out to the Ministry of Civil Affairs' specialist, Muning, at The Chasm.

customize.name: Surreptitious Seven-Star Seal Sundering
customize.desc: You have accepted a commission that requires you to pay The Chasm a visit. Who knows what the situation in the long-sealed mines might be like...

customize.name: Chasm Spelunkers
customize.desc: Now that you have destroyed the Bedrock Keys, the seal on The Chasm has now come undone. It is time to venture into the depths below.

customize.name: First Miasmic Contact
customize.desc: Investigate the mysterious environs beneath the stone and take pictures related to the black mud.

customize.name: Meeting New People... and Foiling Some Bandits
customize.desc: As you explore the lower levels of The Chasm, you discover Treasure Hoarders. If they think you'll let them do things as they please down here, then they've got another think coming!

customize.name: The Heavenly Stone's Debris
customize.desc: To get to ever-deeper levels of The Chasm, you must open the path that was blocked by large stones back when the mine was sealed. Looks like you'll have to borrow the power of the Mountainator this time...

customize.name: Perils in the Dark
customize.desc: The strange crystal plummeted toward the ground and shattered it, revealing an entrance to even greater depths. Who knows what's down there... But either way, it would be best to proceed with caution.

customize.name: Wherefore Did the Spiritstone Descend?
customize.desc: Having taken out the Abyss Lectors lurking here, you discover that Zhiqiong has seen the symbols on the key-like object the Lectors left behind somewhere else...

customize.name: Adventure EXP
customize.desc: Adventure EXP. Used to improve Adventure Rank.

customize.name: Primogem
customize.desc: A primordial crystalline gem that's beyond the mundane world. Shines with the condensed hopes and dreams of universes that once were.

customize.name: Mora
customize.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

customize.name: Hero's Wit
customize.desc:
Character EXP material. Gives 20000 EXP.
These experiences are extremely precious for a pilgrim traveling through Teyvat in order to be closer to Celestia.

customize.name: Lumenstone Ore
customize.desc: The raw ore from which Lumenstone may be found. If processed properly, it can be used to strengthen the Lumenstone Adjuvant you have. Why not hit Jinwu up and ask her?

customize.text:
Enter the mines of <color=#ece5d8>The Chasm</color>
Talk to the team members
Investigate the

customize.name: Lumenspar
customize.desc:
A sky-blue crystal that glitters so brightly that it brings forth echoes of the heavens above, which cannot be seen from underground...

If you hold it up to your ear, you can almost hear a soft sigh coming from within.

This might sound strange, but this crystal also gives off a faint warmth.

customize.name: Zhiqiong
customize.desc: A member of the Adventurers' Guild. She has incredible talent for cartography.

customize.name: Jinwu
customize.desc: A technician who has spent more than 20 years at The Chasm. She is the leader of the Chasm Exploration Team.

customize.text:
Look for clues as to Uncle He's whereabouts
Tell Jinwu about what you've discovered of Uncle He's whereabouts
Go to the exploration team's camp
Talk to Jinwu
Look for Zhiqiong, who went off on her own
Talk to Zhiqiong
Complete Zhiqiong's commission
Return to the exploration team's camp
Talk to Zhiqiong

customize.name: Zhiqiong
customize.desc: A member of the Adventurers' Guild. She has incredible talent for cartography.

customize.name: Jinwu
customize.desc: A technician who has spent more than 20 years at The Chasm. She is the leader of the Chasm Exploration Team.

customize.text:
<color=#ece5d8>The Chasm's Maw, Liyue</color>
<color=#ffffff>Quest Description:</color> <color=#ffffff>Now that you have destroyed the Bedrock Keys, the seal on The Chasm has now come undone. It is time to venture into the depths below.</color>
Quest Objective: Enter the mines of The Chasm
<color=#ece5d8>The Chasm: Underground Mines, Liyue</color>
Quest Objective: Talk to the team members
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Phew, this air sure is familiar! It's been a long time since I came down into these mines.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Don't get careless, Qiong. I for one smell something unfamiliar.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> I mean, we couldn't jump straight down. Maybe we were just distracted by the swaying of the crane.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> You... You've spent too much time above ground.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Paimon didn't smell anything at all... Do all of you miners have such keen noses?
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Haha! A lack of a good nose could forfeit you your life down here! That said, we should still be fine. The finches are still quite lively.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Look, the Lumenspar has grown all the way down here too. That wasn't the case the last time we came down here.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Wow, that really did happen! Let's go have a look!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Y'know... it feels like someone just stole Paimon's thunder.
<color=#ffffff>Quest Description:</color> <color=#ffffff>Having entered The Chasm's lower layers, you can see the great infrastructural works within and comprehend how lively this place must once have been, despite its current desolation... Regardless, it is an adventurer's duty to explore the area.</color>
Quest Objective: Investigate the Lumenspar near the camp
Quest Objective: Talk to Zhiqiong and Jinwu
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> To think that Lumenspar would appear so close to the surface. I was always of the opinion that these things could not appear in more structurally vulnerable locations.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> They are fragments of that "thing" underground, traveling up the veins of the rock before finally arriving here.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Hey! Stop spouting nonsense. They were originally rocks from the local area, which is why they became like this. They just underwent some kind of transformation process and formed crystals, that's all.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> The analyses that the Qixing commissioned us to conduct reveal that they are by and large made of ore from the local area. They've just been affected by some outside force, thus creating these strange crystals.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Huh, look over there! That crystal looks just like the Adjuvant you have with you, Traveler!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Why don't you take the Lumenstone Adjuvant and have a look, Traveler?
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> That's right. The Adjuvant is made of the same material as these crystals. These formations will thus naturally react to one another on account of that similarity.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: How very strange...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: That's pretty amazing...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Hey, is that all you have to say?
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Um, don't fight, you two...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> We're not fighting...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Yeah, we're not...
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> What I mean to say is that it doesn't matter whether you're fighting or not. Zhiqiong and I need to set up a temporary camp up ahead, so don't run off while we're doing that.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> The crystals we discovered will be very useful for our subsequent exploration. If you find anything after this, please make sure to contact me.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> My skills haven't rusted away just yet, so I can help you process some of the raw ore. I believe that it'll prove quite useful to you in your adventures.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> And, um, also... don't fight, alright?
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Got it, got it!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Understood.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> That's a good pair of kiddos. I'll get you some candy later. Anyway, if you find anything strange nearby, please report it in a timely fashion.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Actually, do you remember what Jinwu said the last time about Uncle He...
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> I haven't forgotten. And since you're here, Traveler, could you help me out once again?
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Uncle He is our senior here in the mines. Several years ago, he was one of those who went missing when we Chasm miners were dispersed. He's hard of hearing, and may not have heard the alerts.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> The pensions from Huishan Hall and Shenglu Hall are quite generous, and his family has already long arranged for his funeral... But although I'm not much of a believer in the supernatural, I can't help but feel that he's still alive down here somewhere.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> He really was an old hand. Whether it be avoiding disasters in the mine, how to escape, how to wait for rescue... He knew it all. Taught me a lot of it, too.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> That's why I believe that he must be alive in here somewhere, even now... I won't give up searching for him.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> I'll point you to a few places where he was sighted before we dispersed... Who knows? You might still be able to find some clues there.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> As for me, I'll be exploring the deeper parts of the mining caverns.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: You're not coming with us?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> <color=#ffffff73>She still needs to help us draw some maps. The pathways of The Chasm's underground mines are intricate and complex, and we won't get very far at all without those maps.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Stay safe.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> I'll be fine. It's not like I'm an amateur or anything. Don't you worry about me!
Obtain

customize.name: Lumenstone Adjuvant
customize.desc:
When equipped in The Chasm's Underground Mines, this precious crystal can provide illumination.

It has many similarities to the Glazed Sand Crystal that may only be found within The Chasm, but it stores even greater power within it.
May it be as a sun in your palm, lighting the way through the lightless tunnels and bringing comfort where all is dark.

customize.text:
Optional Dialogue: Talk to Jinwu
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> I believe that Zhiqiong should more or less be done with the map by the time you return.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> However, I still need to wait for the transport team above ground to shift our tools down here, so you're free to explore for the time being.
Quest Objective: Look for clues as to Uncle He's whereabouts
Go near the Geovishap
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Whoa! A monster! It looks... so strange!
Go near the dark mud and the Oozing Concretions
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Ergh, what a horrible smell. Do you smell it too? Whatever it is, let's not get near that dark, muddy stuff!
Read the Diary Fragment near the Geovishap
<color=#ffffff>Diary Fragment:</color> The light is fading... My crystal lamp should last for another 4 hours...
<color=#ffffff>Diary Fragment:</color> ...There's not much food left. I should be able to find the water filter from memory, but we must find a new source of light...
<color=#ffffff>Diary Fragment:</color> Huh, those lights are floating... or are they walking? Am I starting to see things due to a lack of oxygen?
Read the Diary Fragment on the shelf
<color=#ffffff>Diary Fragment:</color> "...When I get too near to the black magma, my thoughts grow jumbled and my senses become agitated. But when I stand close to these crystals, these deleterious effects retreat greatly..."
<color=#ffffff>Diary Fragment:</color> "...I once heard Little Jinwu say that some... 'Adjuvant' thing can be used to store energy from these crystals. I should ask her about that when I get back to the surface..."
<color=#ffffff>Diary Fragment:</color> "...My ears itch. I can hear someone calling out to me, telling me that there is water in the depths. Mushrooms..."
<color=#ffffff>Diary Fragment:</color> "...Oh dear. I fear that I must be going quite insane..."
Read the Diary Fragment at the supply station
<color=#ffffff>Diary Fragment:</color> "Some strange black magma is oozing out of the depths of the earth. I'm not sure if calling it 'magma' is precise... But it looks very ominous. Best not to get near it..."
<color=#ffffff>Diary Fragment:</color> "...I went deeper still and retrieved some strange mushrooms. I'm not certain if they are edible or not..."
<color=#ffffff>Diary Fragment:</color> "...The 'magma' seems to have attracted some elemental lifeforms. Now, if they can eat it, perhaps I could too..."
<color=#ffffff>Diary Fragment:</color> "...No, something's wrong. Something's gone wrong with those little things. I'd better leave. This is surely not to be taken for sustenance..."
<color=#ffffff>Diary Fragment:</color> "...once you get used to it, mushrooms actually don't taste too bad. It might be best to relocate to a spot where mushrooms might be found and to make camp there..."
Find all clues
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Well, these should be the places that Jinwu mentioned. Let's head back and go look for her!
Quest Objective: Tell Jinwu about what you've discovered of Uncle He's whereabouts
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Oh, you're back.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Uncle He left this behind.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Huh? He did, did he? Go on then, tell me!
<color=#ffffff>You tell Jinwu about what you found earlier.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Umm... Black Magma... Lumenstone... and mushrooms?
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Huh. That's weird, and a familiar sort of weird, too. Let's head back to the encampment. It would be best not to linger here.
Quest Objective: Go to the exploration team's camp
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> It's so dark in here. Paimon can hear strange noises... is this what they call "babbling rocks"?
Quest Objective: Talk to Jinwu
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Here we are. Strange... where'd Zhiqiong run off to...
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Hey! Zhiqiong! Zhiqiong!
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> *sigh * I'll wager she's gone running off to some other corner of this place to draw her maps again...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: What's up?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Is Zhiqiong in danger?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Not yet, no. But if she keeps running off without informing me, she will be quite soon!
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> She drew this just after you left.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> She's probably gone deeper in to explore. Please tell her for me that she should quit leaving everyone else behind to go running off by herself.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> If anything bad happens, we're all gonna get dragged down with her. Jinwu's fist will know no mercy, I tell you.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> That sounds... scary...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Pretty scary indeed.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Alright, then. Less idle talk, more action. You can either help me set up here, or you can go scout ahead.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Sorry if I'm not the most courteous character. I just want the things I do to be of use to everyone.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Ah yes, by the way, if you see some raw Lumenstone ore along the way, bring some to me.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> I will find some way to turn them into more effective Adjuvants. As far as my experience can tell me, these things will be very useful down in the mines.
Quest Objective: Look for Zhiqiong, who went off on her own
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Traveler, Zhiqiong is here!
Quest Objective: Talk to Zhiqiong
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Ah, it's you, Traveler! You're here!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Jinwu has some words for you...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> It's that whole spiel about safety again, isn't it? I'm sick of hearing it already.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> I grew up in the mines too. What wouldn't I know about the hazards down here, huh?
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> As for any unknown dangers... Eh, our seniors always used to use their experience to judge whether things were dangerous or not. And in the end, they'd use the results to rationalize their experiences instead.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> I've had it up to here with their arrogance. I'm sure you feel similarly as a senior adventurer, don't you?
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> If Iris was able to scare you off climbing Dragonspine just by giving you the standard safety talk, you would've missed out on so much adventure!
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Alright, stop trying to persuade me. I don't want to argue with you over something this dumb. Can we just, you know, change the topic?
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> I mean, look over here. I'm currently studying the terrain over here, all the better to draw our maps...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: What are you doing here again?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Well, didn't I just say so? I'm studying the terrain and drawing a map.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> It's just that... I found that the way ahead is blocked by some... strange stuff.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> If you could take some samples or pictures of it, I'm sure that both the Ministry of Civil Affairs and the Adventurers' Guild would be quite pleased.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> I would have done it, but... I dropped my Kamera while descending into the mines, so I can only rely on you now, hehe!
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Also, there are a few other spots... Yup. Here, and here. I found the tracks of Treasure Hoarders in these areas...
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Sorry, which place is where now? Paimon didn't understand you at all!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> You just drew a bunch of Xs and lines...
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Hahaha, sorry... Just a force of habit. I always forget that not everyone is born with a natural instinct for cartography.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> But it's alright, I will follow you and show the way ahead.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> We can approach any of these few locations first, so pick whichever you like.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: In that case, let's go.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Be careful while we're on the move.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Thanks for your concern! I'll keep that in mind.
Quest Objective: Complete Zhiqiong's commission
Quest Objective: Return to the exploration team's camp
Quest Objective: Talk to Zhiqiong
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> This is all thanks to you. Please, take this.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Thanks
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Ah, come on, there's no need to be so polite. I mean, Khedive's the one forking out the Mora! Oh, wait, shh... Best we be quiet, lest that stingy scholar from Sumeru hears us.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> *cough* Ahem. Shall we go and look for Jinwu? We can probably probe her experienced mind concerning some of the questions we had on the way.
Additional Dialogue: The player has completed the In the Mountains World Quest
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> You know something? Jinwu doesn't like talking about this, but just like how you're famous for your exploits on Dragonspine, she was also quite the famous figure down at the mines... *cough*
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> I heard that she helped to guide the Millelith search parties, and that they saved a lot of people together. Still, those things are in the past now. I shan't mention them too much, lest she gets mad again.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Alright, I won't keep you any longer.
Optional Dialogue: Talk to Zhiqiong
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Do you need something?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: About your maps...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Eh? My maps? There's honestly not much to be said about them. Before I joined the Adventurers' Guild, I was the mine cartographer.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Of course, I wasn't just some person sitting behind a desk... In fact, we couldn't be more different.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> I was once commissioned by them to map out the terrain of Qiaoying Village... and after all that work, they canceled the construction project just like that, with only a word.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> People like them get assistants to do the dirty exploration work and information-gathering for them, and then they start drawing... But those like me? We can't do that.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> As... well, half a miner myself, I've long gotten used to passing through the dangerous underground passages. It's just the way the job works.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Also, after that great change, the lower levels of The Chasm have really been truly unstable.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Eh? Unstable? Is that very dangerous?
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> You bet it is. The terrain here is slowly but constantly changing. A path today might be a rock wall next month. It's almost as if... How should I say this...
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> It's almost as if The Chasm itself is changing shape as it likes.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Uh... things can't be that spooky, right?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Tell me about your life as an adventurer.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Haha, what? My "life"? You don't have to be so polite. I'm just a newbie. I've barely started my journey, unlike you.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> I have completed some commissions from the Guild, of course, but I'm not that experienced yet, so I haven't done much solo exploration. I don't think I've left any tales of my deeds behind either...
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> So I've been thinking that The Chasm might be just the place for me to make my mark for future generations to remember me by.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> The Chasm might be, to quote the great adventurer Alice, my "Rubicon"!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: The Rubicon... is that hilichurl language?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Paimon's never heard of that one either...
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Well, I'm not too sure myself, but given that Alice is an adventurer who has seen the entire world, so that must be some place she's been to... right?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Your Rubicon, huh? That's pretty impressive.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Wait, you don't even know what that is!
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Haha, regardless, thanks for your encouragement!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: What do you think about Clitopho?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Him? I don't trust him. We've had to deal with the Treasure Hoarders above the mines for who-knows how long. They're up to no good. I know it!
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Don't you trust a word that he says. Turning over a new leaf... Washing his hands of the situation...
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> While they say such pretty words, they'll be reaching their filthy hands into your back pocket.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Even Rex Lapis would have trouble protecting your wallet from them then!
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> I'm not prejudiced or anything... I'm just telling you to be wary. The Treasure Hoarders are never to be trusted.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> That does sound like prejudice to me, though.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> ...Maybe it is. You've probably seen a great many more things than I have, so I guess you might be more generous to them. But as for me, I'll always keep an eye at the back of my head, just for them.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> And I'll keep doing that until this guy can prove that he's got nothing more to do with those despicable "former" companions of his.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: See you around.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> See you!
